channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Becomes the Wild Card in Razor-Thin Honduras Election
item.description: President Trump warned that if his favored candidate didn’t win, the United States would “not be throwing good money after bad” at the country.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry revives his short bet against Tesla, calling the stock ‘ridiculously overvalued’
item.description: Burry first shorted Tesla in 2021 but exited the trade months later.

item.title: Floods in Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand and Vietnam Have Killed Over 1,200. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Unusually destructive storms have killed more than 1,200 people across the region and displaced millions in South and Southeast Asia.

item.title: Bitcoin takes another plunge, chances of reclaiming $100,000 by year end drop to 24% on prediction markets
item.description: Bettors on Kalshi are putting their money on bearish positions.

item.title: Who is Kevin Hassett? The rumored Fed pick says inflation is ‘way down,’ sees ‘political bias’ in jobs data, and suggested firing Powell over a renovation
item.description: “If you’d asked me a year ago, I would have said I think Kevin would be a good pick. I wouldn’t say that today. Kevin has been incredibly dishonest.”

item.title: How a park bench meeting led to Aflac’s $200 million mascot idea
item.description: “Quack, quack, Aflac became the idea,” CEO Dan Amos told Fortune. The adoption of the avian mascot has coincided with a 621% run-up in share price.

item.title: For ‘No Tax on Tips,’ the I.R.S. Gets Intimate
item.description: The Trump administration wants to exclude earnings from “pornographic activity” from a new tax break for tips. Will the I.R.S. know it when it sees it...

item.title: New FDA-approved glasses can slow nearsightedness in kids
item.description: While the technology has previously been available in Europe, Asia and other parts of the world, it’s now rolling out in the U.S.

item.title: TSA Imposes $45 Fee for Travelers Without REAL ID Starting February 2026
item.description: As of February, passengers without the government-approved identity card will be required to pay for alternative screening at U.S. airports.

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Demands Netflix Drop 50 Cent Series, Citing New Footage
item.description: The mogul’s lawyers told the streaming service to withdraw a documentary because it was produced by his rival and uses footage they say was “illicitly...

item.title: Trump Becomes the Wild Card in Razor-Thin Honduras Election
item.description: President Trump warned that if his favored candidate didn’t win, the United States would “not be throwing good money after bad” at the country.

item.title: Zelensky Meets With European Leaders Amid Peace Deal Talks
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine met with President Emmanuel Macron of France on Monday in Paris to discuss the terms of the Trump administrati...

item.title: Zelensky Turns to Europe After Talks With U.S. Officials
item.description: Ukraine’s president met with President Emmanuel Macron of France on Monday as Steve Witkoff, President Trump’s special envoy, was traveling to Russia.

item.title: An Anti-Polarization Pope
item.description: What Pope Leo’s first international trip tells us about the leader of the Catholic Church.

item.title: Floods in Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand and Vietnam Have Killed Over 1,200. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Unusually destructive storms have killed more than 1,200 people across the region and displaced millions in South and Southeast Asia.
